revised_title: Second Memoir on the Curves Satisfying Given Conditions: The Principle of Correspondence
tldr: This paper explores the theory of curves that satisfy given conditions, focusing on the principle of correspondence. It discusses the application of this principle to determining the number of conics that meet specific conditions, such as contact with a given curve. The author also introduces the concept of the "supplement" to account for special solutions and provides a method for determining the expression of the supplement.
